Name: Sambesi
Description: The infamous animal catcher Sandro Saebel has caught wild animals and cooped them up in an enclosure. The players have the task to set the animals free before Sandro is aware of it. For each animal that is brought back the player gets points. Motor is a die, which let small wooden boats through the river.

Name: Run
Description: The idea is to bring your own unbeaten pawns through the round course to their destination. At the same time you must try to catch as many of the opposition stones as possible with your catch stones.

Name: Risky
Description: The idea is to collect on a round course as many stones of your color as possible and to bring them to your destination.

Name: Prost
Description:
Prost is a funny entertainment game for 2-4 people.
The idea is to tap a barrel of beer and to fill your 40 beer steins as fast as you can. Much depends on the luck of the dice rolling of your co-players.

Name: Diktator
Description: The four team partners are supposed to bring down the dictator in a common action. They succeed when the dictator pawn (red double pawn)can be beaten. When one color of the team partners has dropped out, the dictator has won.

Name: Rennraupe Rosalie
Description:
from the instruction:

A game with colored dice for 2 to 4 quick players Ages 4 and up.

Hush! Can you hear pattering of the caterpillars`little feet? In an exciting competition, the colorful caterpillars crawl busily along their paths.
The dice determines which caterpillar will be the first to arrive.

Name: Doppelspass
Description:
It's a soccer game that was published 2005, one year before World championship 2006.
Two dice move 3 pawns and 2 goalkeeper over the field to score more goals than your opponent.

Name: Benjamin
Description: The idea of BENJAMIN is to entertain a group of people of different age. Each player is forced to contribute something for the entertainment of the players. The winner is the one who fulfills these tasks the best.The players have to move around a board with fields with different meanings. These different jobs have to be fulfilled.

Name: Revanche
Description:
The game idea: Revanche is a game with two parts. Each player is once the aggressor and once the defender. The aggressor wins anyway, the question is only, in how many turns. The tactic of the defender is to postpone his defeat as long as possible, in order, when the opponent has to give him revenge, to defeat him now as aggressor in a lower amount of turns.
For 2 players.
The material contains: a board, 4 pawns of the aggressor, 2 pawns of the defender and the rule.
It is one game o the legendary E-series of FX Schmid.

Name: Red Lorry, Yellow Lorry
Description: This simple children's game from the Clementoni Young Learners series of games is based on dominoes. The playing pieces consist of a starting piece  (a crossroads with 4 roads leading from it and attached spinner) and 24 domino-like tiles with 2 vehicles on each of varying types and colors. To start the game each player is dealt an equal number of the vehicle tiles and the crossroads is placed in the centre of the table. The players then take turns spinning the spinner, and must attempt to place one of their tiles on whichever of the roads is pointed to. Tiles placed must match either the color or type of the vehicle currently at the end of this road. The winner is the first player to get rid of all of their tiles. Some strategy is provided by one of the tiles being a police car which can be placed at any time and permanently blocks off the road it is player on.

Name: Memoir '44: Winter 2007 Scenario
Description:
This postcard expansion contains one Memoir '44 battle scenario - Baraque de Fraiture (Parker's Crossroads) - December 20-23, 1944 - as part of the Battle of the Bulge.

The postcard was created as a holiday season limited edition by Days of Wonder and made available via their website or FLGS.  The scenario can now be viewed at Days of Wonder's Memoir '44 Military Archives.

In addition to the base game, the Eastern Front expansion is required for play and the Winter/Desert Board Map is recommended for cosmetic reasons.

Part of the Memoir '44 series.

Expands:

    Memoir '44 (required)
    Memoir '44: Eastern Front (required)
    Memoir '44: Winter/Desert Board Map (recommended)

Name: Wunderwelt Wissen: Das Spiel
Description:
Players act as editors in search of interesting themes for the next broadcast.

To win you have to have knowledge in six different categories (like history, technology, nature, ...)

It's a trivia game relating to the tv show "Wunderwelt Wissen".

Name: Tatu Brasilis and Steps and Snakes
Description:
Tatu Brasilis
Help the Armadillo to arrive in the party in a unforgettable journey inside Brazil. You will help him to cross some dangerous and will discovery the beauties of the country.

Steps and Snakes
In return of the party of the Armadillos, you goes to follow our friends Armadillos to the beach and learn a lot of things about trips, like dangerous and good ways to have a good trip.

Name: Hexagonal Chess for three
Description:
This is a variant of Hexagonal Chess by W. Glinski - a variant designed for three players.

Each player starts from his own board corner of the hexagonal board (120 degrees from his rivals). Rules of pieces movement are the same as in two-player version (with the exception that there is no main front-back board axis but every player has his own one determining pawn movement). The player who checkmates any of the enemies' kings wins, the checkmated player and the third one (a.k.a. "observer") both lose.

Name: Indicios Junior
Description:
The game of the 10 clues.

Similar than original Indicios but oriented to children.

The teams must guess the secret word on the card with as few clues as possible.

Wins who ends the 4 tracks corresponding to 4 topics: Geography, Nature, Prominent figures and Miscellaneous.

Was edited in Argentina by Etapa Nueva S.A.

Name: Wüstenkönige
Description:
Who rules the sand?

In Wüstenkönige you decide this question with a tactical race through the changing desert. The winner will be the new lord of the sand.

But take care! There are many traps on your way. Sandstorms menace to overwhelm your camels, flying carpets cross your way and even within the oasis your are not safe of epidemics.

A smart coordination of your camels and a visionary use of your powers will bring you to the throne and send your enemies back to the desert.

Name: Sweep!
Description:
SWEEP! is based on the sport of Curling and the objective is to place your rocks closer to the center of the scoring circle than your opponent.  This game is played on a board which represents a Curling rink.  Each player, in turn, will choose which lane they are throwing from and draw a card from one of 8 different decks which each represent a different type of throw/strategy which informs you as to the result of that throw.

Game components include the following:

1 curling rink gameboard (14 x 28 grid)
2 plastic brooms
16 plastic stones (8 red & 8 black)
8 packs of cards representing different throws
1 shot diagram chart illustrating each throw

Name: Lien Poh
Description:
This is a Hokkien gambling game played in South-east Asia. Lien Poh literally translates as 'turning treasure'. The cube is the Poh or 'treasure' and the metal box is the Poh Kam or 'treasure cover'.

Most Poh have the same face on all sides, with the functional part being the red and white colouring/marking. The red portion is a stylized Chinese character, Tong, and the white portion is another character, Ying. However, there are examples where the design is completely abstract and sides may have different designs.

There are known instances where the characters are å¯¶ and é€š (bao and tong).

In order to play the game, a betting diagram is roughly drawn on paper - a square sheet is divided into four triangular areas by two diagonal lines. Punters bet on which area the red side will end up facing.

The person operating the game puts the Poh into the Poh Kam, leaving a bit of room for the Poh to be rattled around inside. It then settles into the smaller part of the metal container and the Poh Kam is closed all the way. The whole block is then spun. When it comes to rest, the block is placed in the centre of the diagram so that each side lines up with one of the 4 areas. The cover is lifted and the red side will be facing one of the 4 areas - punters who bet in that area win their bet.

The game is described in C.T. Dobree's book, Gambling Games of Malaya (q.v.) and it mentions that the name of the game in Kelantan is 'Ewok'. There's also a description of how operators of the game could cheat at it.


The game is also described in Stewart Culin's book "Chinese Games with Dice and Dominoes" on pages 507-508. He writes:

The po tsz', or covered die, is not, properly, a die game at all.  It consists of a small wooden cube, which is placed in a square receptacle in the top of a brass prism, over which a brass cover fits very closely.  A specimen exhibited by His Highness, the Sultan of Johore in the section of games at the Columbian Exposition consisted of a wooden cube about one-half an inch square, having one-half of each face painted red and one-half white.  The prism in which the cube fitted was slightly convex on the bottom, and, when placed upon a smooth surface, could be twirled rapidly.  The game is played by placing the box containing the po in the center of a square crossed by diagonal lines, which is drawn upon a mat.  One of the four divisions of the square is painted red.  One of the four divisions of the square is painted red.  The players lay their bets upon the other divisions and the box is spun rapidly by the gamekeeper, who repeats the operation until it comes to rest squarely with the corners corresponding with the indersecting lines.  The cover is then lifted, and those who have staked opposite the red side of the die win.  The banker wins when the red side comes opposite the side of the square painted red.  There is said to be a current notion, amounting to a superstition among the Chinese in Johore, that if a player stops the box as it is spinning the luck will surely go against him.

Another specimen in the Sultan's collection, called at Johore, kong poh (Chinese t'ung po), "current treasure," furnishes an explanation of the name po.  It consists of a wooden die, with a face 1 3/8 inches square, and three-forths inch thick, which fits into a brass box with a broad base.  A wooden cover fits over the box.  This die is not spun, but is concealed in a bag which accompanies it, and there adjusted by the gamekeeper.  The face of the wooden die is carved with the characters t'ung po, on one side in the ordinary, and on the reverse in seal characters, the character t'ung being painted red, and po white.  The inscription t'ung po "current treasure," occurs on the face of all modern Chinese coins, and the common name of the game is evidently derived from the character po, which occurs on this block.

It should be noted that when Culin refers to "po tsz'" he most likely means "tóu zi" (éª°å­) which is usually translated as just "dice" and not "covered die."  When he refers to the die with the characters "t'ung po" written upon it, he is refering to tÅng bÇŽo (é€šå¯¶) which means "open treasure" not "current treasure."

Name: Hollywood Casting
Description:
'Hollywood Casting' is a face building game. The young lady in the frame is a drama student who dreams of becoming a hollywood starlet, so the story goes. 
'Hollywood Casting' is about quick decision-making and risk taking. The aim of the game is to create the tallest possible face by selecting and assembling different face tiles. When it is their turn, players roll the dice and select a face tile corresponding to the colour or part of the face shown on the dice, and add it to their face under construction. When a player has completed a face, there may still be room to improve it before everyone else has finished theirs, and the game is over. However, the first player to complete a face on an entirely red background or a 'rainbow' face where each tile has a different background colour, wins immediately.

Name: Babylon Challenge
Description: Babylon Challenge is  a set of anagrams. One determines a number of letters then one starts to pile up the polygons in the center of the desk. Each one seeks to form a word with the letters compared to its position of play. The six players have including each one 6 different pullings. As soon as a player finds a word, it advances on its track of score from 1 to 3 boxes according to the length of the word to find. When it falls on a Babylon box, it must answer a question in the shape of play of the vat under penalty of moving back.

Name: Down Under: The Australian Pub Game
Description:
Players add marbles two at a time into any of five chutes in a wooden tower. Once all of each players twenty marbles are distributed, blindly (the tower is a solid block of wood), the tower is slowly slid along a grooved path that distributes the marbles in the order they were placed into an even grid of depressions. Each player scores for marbles that appear in a row of four, either diagonally or orthogonally, and any line of five counts as two four-in-a-rows.

It's a quick game of memory and patterns, and it engages blocking and building strategies.

Name: MAM !!!
Description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION

    
    
         The information that BGG has on this item indicates that MAM !!! is a non-authorized version of SET.

    


Each card contains 1-3 matching objects, in one of three colors, shapes, and shadings. Twelve cards are laid out, and the first person to spot a set of three collects those cards. The cards are replaced from the deck and play continues.

A set consists of three cards which are either all alike or all different in each attribute: for instance, if all three cards have the same number of objects, but different shapes, shadings, and colors, then they're a set. If two of the cards have a common attribute that is not shared by the third, they are not a set.

Name: Elf-Mann-Ho
Description:
From the author:

"Elf-Mann-Ho is a chess-like game for fast-thinkers. Skilled moving of the fast runners, the goal getters and other players is the way to win the game. Goals are shot at with a twenty-sided die - a really realistic boardgame about soccer."

The game contains:
1 board
1 D20
2 D6 
1 D8
10 "normal" soccer pawns in red and yellow
2 goalies
2 forwards
6 runners
6 dribblers
1 ball
1 knitting needle to measure how long (and where) the ball is shot

Name: Football Cards
Description:
Football Cards is a hand management game, simulating soccer match. There are 56 cards in the pack:

- 52 actual playing cards with pictures of several key Polish football players from national team 
- 1 rules card
- 1 "flow of game" card
- 2 legend cards

Game is divided into two halves, like in a normal soccer game. In each half players tried to score goals by playing cards with ball symbol and defend opponents attacks by playing cards with goal symbol. There are several "special" cards simulating free kicks, penalties and offsides.

Name: TANKS you're welcome
Description: Simple roll, move and shoot game. Eliminate their tanks or capture their flag to win. Box says Ages 10 and up, but most 5 or 6 yr olds will be able to play. 29 x 29 square play field with obstacles the block movement and shots.

Name: Wings of War: Dogfight Booster Pack
Description:
Each Wings of War Booster Pack includes a set of 72 new cards (half the cards normally included in a complete set of Wings of War) which expands on the existing games and allow the players to fly 2 additional planes.

With the Dogfight booster pack, the RAF Se5a and the Siemens Schuckert D.III  and D.IV come to life in Wings of War. They come with two new maneuver deck each. The cards feature several planes from the First World War, plus two Se5a of the Poland and Soviet air forces from the post-1918 conflicts in Eastern Europe.

A Wings of War Booster Pack is not a complete game. The Dogfight Booster requires either Famous Aces or Burning Drachens.

Part of the Wings of War series

Name: Wings of War: Immelmann Booster Pack
Description:
Each Wings of War Booster Pack includes a set of 72 new cards (half the cards normally included in a complete set of Wings of War) which expands on the existing games and usually allow the players to fly 2 additional planes. This specific booster has three maneuvre decks instead, giving the opportunity to fly three machines instead.

In the Immelmann booster pack, some of the earlier fighters are included in the game: Fokker E.III and E.IV, Morane Saulnier N, Airco DH2. Airplanes with both single and twin machineguns are included, featuring also a couple of experimental machines that saw actual action: a twin-MG Halberstadt D.III and a Fokker E.IV with three Mgs that was flown personally by Max Immelmann.

The decks included are two copies of the new P one and a copy of the G. The latter was already included in the Watch Your Back! box.

A Wings of War Booster Pack is not a complete game. The Immelmann Booster Pack requires to play any other Wings of War game set (Famous Aces, Watch Your Back!, Burning Drachens), with the special rules for replacing B damage cards with A ones if you don't have them (halving damages down).

Part of the Wings of War series

Name: The Desert Game
Description: This game published by the Sage Publishing Company in 1979 is a Trivia type Game where players are tested on their knowledge of the desert environment. Questions about   Why a pit viper is called a pit viper (the pit vipers have developed special organs of heat reception that help them to sense warm-blooded animals, an ability that is especially useful at night, when many of them hunt. These organs consist of pits, for which the group is named)  and What creature impales its prey on cactus thorns?  (Loggerhead Shrikes (they are a bird) often impale reptiles and small mammals after the prey becomes tired from being chased.)

Name: Imperial Starmada Sourcebook
Description:
From the website.....

"So it was with a sense of relief, rather than concern, that the citizens of Terra watched the ascension to power of Purser Wheylan.

"To them, the one-time opposition leader offered a chance for humanity to pull itself from the ashes, and more importantly, for Terra to take back her rightful place as the center of human civilization…"
—Vicar Buros (AA +315- )

Welcome to the Imperial Starmada Sourcebook, the first in what is hoped to be a long series of setting books in support of the Starmada game.

These pages describe the universe of the Imperial Starmada: the interstellar naval arm of the Terran military. Although in a state of uneasy peace with its immediate neighbors, the Starmada is now faced with its greatest threat—an alien power of unknown size, strength, and intention. Can the Terrans summon a coalition to face down this new adversary, or will old enmities force the Empire to its knees?

In addition to historical background for five different factions in the Starmada universe, the Imperial Starmada Sourcebook includes:

* Thirty starship designs for the Starmada and its major adversaries;
    * New starship options and weapon traits, including anti-fighter batteries, overthrusters, limited ammunition, and more;
    * Rules for three-dimensional movement and combat interception;
    * The "Simplest Campaign System"; and
    * A complete board game that can be used as a scenario generator for Starmada.

The Imperial Starmada Sourcebook is not a stand-alone product; ownership of the Starmada Admiralty Edition Core Rulebook is required.

Expands:

    Starmada: The Admiralty Edition

Name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Battle Pack Alpha
Description: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Battle Pack Alpha (Second Edition) now comes in full color with 14 scenarios designed to increase the replayability of your Lock "n Load Tactical series.  Lock 'n Load Tactical: Battle Pack Alpha (Second Edition) includes missions in the jungles of Vietnam, the streets of Arnhem, and the small Belgian village of Foy. There are Jewish Partisans defending their home, German panzers attacking a Russian bridgehead, and North Vietnamese regulars storming an American-held hill. We now include updated maps and maps with the overlays printed right on them. We have also included 5 free bonus X-Maps.

Name: The Errand Boy
Description:
Extrapolated from description by eBay seller Walnutts for ebay:

The 2 fold, chromo-lithographed Game Board measures approx. 10 1/4” x 20” and features 2 images in the center - one showing the “Good” Errand Boy and the “Bad” Errand Boy and the other the interior of a Banking Office. Scenes at each corner of the Board and text the spaces on the board relate to various events (both positive and negative) in the career of a Errand Boy. The object of the game is to work your way up from "Applicant" to "Banker” using the spinner located on the game board to decide on movement.The game box features chromo-lithographed paste down illustration of an American street scene with the dedicated Errand Boy protecting his package while a roust-about competitor is seen dropping his packages, smoking a cheroot, getting in a fight and generally messing up his duty.

Name: Voter's Choice Election Game
Description: From Are You Game advertisement.  Make your run for President of the United States! Win the primaries and the popular votes and you're on your way to Pennsylvania Ave! This exciting strategy game takes you through choosing a platform, beginning a state election, to buying a campaign headquarters, and entering a debate. You'll have fun while learning with this great game. Who knows maybe you'll find a budding politico in your midst!

Name: Rain
Description:
The goal of the game is to race your raindrops down the window. The player with the most raindrops moved off the end of the window at the end of the game wins.

A modular board is used, with an extension being added for three player and a further extension for four player.  Cards are drawn that dictate the number of raindrops added to the board and the movement of the raindrops. To progress down the board larger raindrops are required at each row. Any raindrop moved off the end of the board is collected. At the end of the game the number of individual drops collected is totaled and the player with the highest number of drops wins.

Name: Excalibur (NAC)
Description:
Role playing game based on easy rules and a variable mapboard created by tile placement.

Players select a character to play, distribute freely 10 points of   attributes (strength,dexterity and intelligence) and begin to explore an aleatory world,  killing monsters and accomplishing missions to get victory points.

The map tiles have paths that must be connected one with another and the players can move only thought the path. When one character moves out of the board a new tile is placed and he can find a new mission, a monster or the entry to a small secondary mapboard: lake, dwell, wood, etc.

Every player has an individual mission and there is the  global mission of "finding Excalibur" that is active for all players.

Characters can attack one another to steal weapons, objects and mission cards. Combat is resolved by very simple rules.
Families: Theme: King Arthur / The Knights of the Round Table / Camelot

Name: Landnám
Description:
Landnám, literally land-taking, is the Old Norse term for the settlement of the North Atlantic islands in the viking age. This game focuses on this aspect of the period, which though less violent than certain contemporary events was not entirely without conflicts of its own.

The game consists of the exploration of an island, building settlements there and aquiring power and glory by winning legal disputes at the Althing – coincidentally corresponding to the three ages of Icelandic history between the Norse discovery of the island in the 9th century and the country's submission to the Norwegian crown in 1262: Landnámaöld, Söguöld and Sturlungaöld.

Though sharing core mechanics with the Catan range of games, the overall flow of the game differ markedly from each of these.

The game's home page contains a fuller description, including the rules and downloadable PDF files for the components.

Name: Milo's Magical Card Game
Description:
From the back of the box: "...a variation on the ever-popular game Happy Families, will delight children aged 4-up as it helps reinforce basic counting, colour identification, memory, and puzzle-solving skills." Game features cards with pictures by Marcus Pfister from his Milo books.

The cards also double as eight simple puzzles which form larger pictures when combined.

Name: Fast Track Derby
Description:
Fast Track Derby is an exciting new horse racing board game that the entire family will love. It has all the thrills of cheering your horse to victory, in an easy to play board game that’s both fast-paced and incredibly fun.

A beautiful, high-quality board game that looks as good as it plays.

Cheer your horse around the track to the finish line, and take home the prize!!

Perfect for all Ages 6 and up.

Great, wholesome family fun - No gambling references or odds – just the thrills and excitement of pure horse racing.

There’s nothing like the feeling of cheering your horse to victory at the racetrack. And there’s no board game that captures that feeling quite like Fast Track Derby. It can be learned in five minutes, and can be played by 2-8 people for hours on end. Your entire family will be cheering their horse as they round’ the track on their way to the finish line!! “C’mon number three!!"

Name: The Category Game
Description:
The Category Game is a word/trivia game for ages 6 and up. In many ways, it can be seen as a simplified form of 'Scattergories.'

In a given round, five category cards and five letter cards are dealt out in two parallel lines. After the timer is flipped, players have a set amount of time to come up with as many answers as possible corresponding to each category/letter pair. Once the timer runs out, duplicates answers are eliminated and points are scored for each remaining answer.

The player with the most points after four rounds is the winner.

Box contains:
24 Category Cards
24 Letter Cards
1 Timer
Rules

Name: Martian Gunslinger
Description:
"In the western areas of Mars, where men are men and the horses love them for that, is the setting for our tale of power, control and a really nice peanut butter and jelly sandwich. This is where the land is untamed, the people are wild and lawlessness reigns. Do you have what it takes to make your mark on this dusty land and call yourself a true Martian Gunslinger?"

The entire game is found at the Icehouse Games Wiki

Game System

    Icehouse Pieces


Design Competitions

    Ice Game Design Competition - Entry in 7th Competition

Name: The Amusing Game of Yes or No
Description:
"Yes or No"

A Laughable game for six or less players


    Players sit around a table and distribute the question cards without looking at them. The answer slips are scattered face up in the center of the table.


Players then pick answers of the right kind (yes/no or time period) for each of the question cards in order without knowing what the questions are.

Once all answers are drawn, players read the question cards in order and the answers that every other player has picked for this question.


    Paraphrased from the game instruction sheet.

Name: Sagentuch aus Goerlitz
Description:
The goal of the (simple) game is to jump up with your pawn fastest on a so-called "legend stone" to reach the matching legend field with him. The players move their pawns by dice roll and can move other players' pawns according to different rules. The beautiful map (printed by serigraphy) is designed after 6 typical local legends, the suitable stories are added within the game.

The game was developed and produced by several different companies based in Görlitz. Görlitz is the most eastern city in Germany.

Name: Warhammer: Skirmish
Description:
Warhammer Skirmish is not a stand alone game, but does provide some modifications to the basic Warhammer Fantasy Battle system.

The book contains 25 scenarios for playing small scale skirmish battles, with forces from anywhere between 2-30 figures a side.

The scenarios are, as you would expect from a Games Workshop product, lavishly illustrated and interspersed with modeling advice and ways to change the scenarios to suit your own figure collections.

The book itself is 50 full colour pages and was priced at $3.95

From the back of the book:

"Endlessly deep ranks of infantry, massed batteries of ear machines and archers firing volley after volley, swords crashing on shields and armor in and unrelenting sea of battle. Such occurrences are not uncommon in the Warhammer world. However, not all important battles take places between two massive armies clashing over a sweeping battlefield. Some of the most crucial skirmishes are fought on an entirely different scale, one that may never be recorded in history, but are no less meaningful in the grand scheme of things."

For some reason Warhammer Skirmish was never released outside of the USA and Canada.

Name: Giebo Giedze
Description: Giebo Giedze is a traditional Tibetan board game for two players. One player has two kings and the other one 24 Queens. The aim of the player with the kings is to jump over the Queens to kill them all, and the aim of the player with the Queens is to block the kings' movement, like in the Nepal board game Bagh Chal.

Name: Moon Dragon: Birds of Prey
Description:
Expansion kit for Moon Dragon.

Includes:

    New factions - Alpha Colony, Lunar Freedom Alliance
    New weapons for fighters
    Ground Defenses
    Pilot Characteristics
    Mission Builder rules

Name: Kingdom of Heroes
Description:
The king is dying and the kingdom is overrun by chaos. Four of his five daughters are in peril. Soon he shall choose his successor among the nobles called to save the princesses and help rid the kingdom from its enemies. However, the candidate to the throne must also marry one of the princesses.

The players represent those nobles, who wish to prove their value and leadership by sending heroes to complete various missions. They will count on the help of the Royal Wizard Zatorius and Princess Sapphire, who has become a knight of great bravery.

Each turn, the players move a party of heroes and allocate them to missions, represented by cards placed on the board. Heroes of different players may cooperate to complete a mission and share the rewards, but only one takes the card. They should attempt to form sets of different mission types. Most fame points are earned in the end, according to the cards won. The noble who has most fame and the heart of a princess will become the new king.

Name: Kreta: Operation Merkur
Description:
A Battle Study on the German Invasion of Crete

KRETA contains:
    * Chapter OM, that includes rules for new units, terrain types, weapons notes and historical Campaign (6 pages)
    * 7 Historical Map Scenarios
    * 10 Geomorphic Map Scenarios
    * Huge Color 56"x40" Historical Map featuring Maleme battle area, drawn by Tom Repetti
    * 122 full color counters (37 large, 85 small)

Name: Big Big Battles: Crawly Combat
Description:
An all-ages miniatures game. The game is played using coloring book style paper craft miniatures that are assembled and colored by the players. Crawly Combat is the first series of Big Big Battles miniatures and focuses on the imaginary battles between teams insects and other small animals.

Unique to Big Big Battles - Crawly Combat is that players chose a “base” at the start of the game. The base determines how a player can build a team, what a player can do on their turn, and establishes a victory condition/scenario for that player.

Name: Lettro
Description:
This game is available in English and in French

A terrific card game involving strategy and the letters of the alphabet.

The highest card wins the hand, but watch out for the wild card that can play tricks on you. The player with the most hands wins.

Playing the game: 
The players choose at random who deals first. This player deals the cards based on the number of players and places the deck of remaining cards face down on the table. The player cuts the deck to determine the trump colour which is the highest ranking suit. The player then places the trump reminder card face up on the table for all to see. The player to the dealer’s left goes first. The first player lays one card face up on the table. Each player takes turns playing a card of the same colour as the colour requested. If a player does not have a card of the colour requested, he or she may play a trump colour, a card of a different colour or a Lettro TM card. The player with the highest card wins the hand. Then the winner of the hand plays the first card, and so on.

If more than one Lettro card is played in a round, the last player to play a Lettro card wins the hand. When a player plays a Lettro card, he or she can change the trump immediately, but players who have not yet completed
the round must play cards of the colour originally requested. After all the cards have been played, enter each player’s number of hands won. Then change dealers.

Components: 
26 red cards from A to Z, 26 blue cards from A to Z, 26 yellow cards from A to Z, 26 green cards from A to Z, 4 Lettro cards, 2 trump, reminder cards, Game rules.

Name: Ides of March: The End of the Roman Republic 44BC – 30BC
Description:
On the Ides of March (15 March) 44BC, ruler of Rome, Gaius Julius Caesar was assassinated in the Senate house by a small group of disaffected senators.  After a brief period of confusion, three factions began to emerge to fill the vacuum left by Caesar’s death.  The Tyrannicides led by Marcus Junius Brutus and assisted by Gaius Cassius Longinus left Rome and took provinces in the East to govern, there to bide their time, gather strength, and hopefully complete the restoration of the Republic.  A second faction under Marcus Antonius, Senior Consul and Caesar’s chief lieutenant, and supported by Marcus Aemilius Lepidus, initially attempted to come to an accommodation with the Tyrannicides with the intent securing a power-base in Cisalpine Gaul and subsequently to seize control in Rome.  The third faction under Gaius Octavius, Caesar’s nephew and adopted son, was intent upon claiming his inheritance and assuming the position that was Caesar’s in the state.  Initially making common cause with Decimus Brutus (a tyrannicide) and the Senate, he attempted to check Antony’s ambitions whilst pursuing a dual agenda of avenging Caesar and assuming primacy in the state.  By 30BC, Octavius (later Augustus Caesar) had eliminated all competition and become the undisputed Leader of Rome.

Ides of March is a three-player simulation representing the end of the Roman Republic, with each faction vying for control of the state through both political and military means.  As the Leader of one of the three major factions, you control the Leaders, forces, and political resources of your faction in a struggle to win personal control of the machinery of state and thus become “Princeps”, or undeclared Emperor of the Roman World.  Rules to play the game with two-players are found at the end of this rulebook.

A shorter Rubicon Module simulates the earlier struggle between Julius Caesar and Pompey the Great who was backed by the Senate that ultimately led to Caesar’s victory and assumption of the position of Dictator-for-Life.  Each separate game shares a common set of Strategy Cards, with cards specific to period of civil war added the common deck for the play of that module.  Players share a force pool of land  and special Units, as well as factional naval forces and major Leaders/generals.

Name: Oktagrid
Description:
Oktagrid is a game for up to four Wizards.

This game was created by the Archmage Pedramor the Wise, trying to find a peaceful way to resolve magical duels.

Oktagrid is played on a octagonal chessboard.
Every player controls a Wizard: moving it on outer part of the board, the miniature activates the magical Runes, which can create and move the Oktawoods, the enchanted pieces of this ancient game.
The player that scores the higher number of Oktawoods, moving them to the center of the board, is the winner.

The game has two set of rules, basic (suitable for children) and advanced, for more experienced players. 
The game is entirely language independent; all the pieces are made of wood, except the four miniatures of the Wizards, made in Kerasin-S and hand painted.

Name: IBAL (In Bocca al Lupo)
Description:
It's winter time.
Two hungry wolves are looking at a peaceful sheep... They run to catch the poor animal, with their fangs ready to strike...
...And a big, valiant dog jumps over the sheep, interposing a muscular body between the helpless sheep and the hungry wolves...

The hunt begins.

IBAL is a game for two players of any age. 
A player controls the wolves, the other one controls the dog and the sheep.
Using two different action decks, players try to reach their objective moving their pieces on the board.
Wolves win by catching the sheep, the dog wins by catching one of the wolves.
When the game ends, players switch sides.

Easy to learn, language independent, the game is entirely designed and illustrated by the author.

Name: AiaGaia
Description:
AiaGaia is an hilarious, fast paced party game, appropriate and enjoying for children, and funny for adults and gamers. The game is entirely language independent.

Players try to score points by putting in play the animals of a farm, or special characters like the Farmer and his family, playing Foxes and Moles against other players, and trying to avoid the terrible black Wolf...

Every card in play has a value in points, as every card in hand entail a penalty... 
In addition, many animals (and all the characters), have special "effects" based on the other cards on the play field...
But beware! When you put a card in play, you have to simulate the "voice" of the animal (or character) on the card: if you forget, or if you mistake, the card jumps back in your hand, and you lose your turn!

High interaction, many laughs and a bit of tactics are the recipe of this game, designed by Marco Valtriani and illustrated by Angelo Porazzi.

THE GAME IS OUT OF STOCK and will not be reprinted. It has been restyled (rules, graphics, illustrations) and published by Red Glove.
New page here: http://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/165651/merry-yard

Name: Demo
Description:
One thing is to go onto a demonstration.
A completely different is to organize them!
And whether this has the desired effect within the media is not only a question of the size.

Proclaim one demonstration after another!
Make them big!
Give them events!
Make them popular!

But don't lose control, or the only ones who can help you are the policemen.

A tactical card-placing-game for everybody who likes to use his democratic basic rights.

Name: Game of Logic
Description:
Lewis Carroll's Game of Logic was initially published as a book with two boards and a set of cardboard counters. The game employs Carroll's bilateral and trilateral diagrams to solve logic puzzles in the book.

In the preface Lewis Carroll remarked:
     Besides nine counters, it also requires one Player, at least. I am not aware of any Game that can be played with less than this number: while there are several that require more.

Name: Island Hoppers
Description: Using a map based on actual places, this game relies on a card-drawing mechanic for players to determine their end-game strategy.  The object is to build terminals and gates at airports, purchase a fleet of various aircraft, and hopefully, overcome pirates and mother nature to fly your routes and collect fares.  The player who manages to keep his fleet intact and successfully fly his routes will have the advantage...until a hurricane hits his home base.

Name: Winds of War
Description:
An LPS bonus mini-game, Winds of War (WoW) is a look at the efforts of the Japanese during World War II to create chaos, confusion and consternation in the United States by bombing the western portion of the states by means of explosives carried in wind-born, hydrogen-filled balloons.  Sounds nutty, but it’s true.  Anyway, WoW is a game; any hints of simulation are just that, hints, although everything in the game is based on what actually happened.  It’s a bit of a hoot, but it doesn’t take long to play – about 90 minutes - and is much in the spirit of what the game industry calls “Euros”.

The game may be played by one or two players.

CAVEAT… and a Word on WoW’s  Genesis

No game designer in his right mind would ever think of doing a game on this subject. I, to be sure, am not of the Right-Minded tribe.  The origins of this game arise from a statement I made on Consimworld that there is no subject about which one cannot design a game. Consimworld being what it is, it took about 38 seconds before a half dozen “Oh yeah?”  Prove it!” statements followed. The result was a folder entitled “The Richard Berg Game Design Challenge”, wherein dozens of titles were suggested. These were narrowed down to a half dozen Prime Time Possibilities by a panel of judges who, from that half dozen, chose this subject as “ungameable”. Me? I would have thought The Children’s Crusade would be a lot more difficult.  But I have accepted that challenge, and this is what comes from such public foolishness.

Name: Jenga Cubes
Description:
Jenga Cubes is part of the Jenga series of games.  The logo printed on the tower matches the Jenga logo on the rest of the series.

The game consists of 25 dice-like black cubes, each with blue, green, and red faces.  The cubes stack nicely inside a Plexiglas tower that has slots cut out on alternating sides at each level (24 on the tower and 1 dislodged cube).  It is possible to carefully push out cubes leaving the above cubes in place by ensuring that that the remaining cube supports the ones above.

The rules of the game differ from those of the traditional Jenga in which, the players will each be assigned a color (by way of rolling one of the dice) and will try to make one of the faces of the tower all of their color (e.g. orange player will try to make one of the faces of the tower orange).

Every turn the player will roll the dislodged cube, and take the color face-up and push it against in the tower (using any side) until a cube on the opposite side falls out. If it is not possible to push that color, the dice is re-rolled.

 Note: if the cube that comes up lands with the face-up of your color, you get another turn (no limit on turns as long as your color keeps coming up).

Name: Presidentinvaalipeli
Description:
The goal of the game is to get your candidate to be the president of Finland. In the game there are three election rounds. The first round is a competition between the candidates of a election coalition, who gets to be the candidate for the next round. On the next round the two main candidates are chosen. On the third round it is determined who wins "the chair of the president"( Pressan pallin, in Finnish).

The game was produced on the election year of 1984 and lends a great deal of basic mechanics from Pacheesi.

Name: The Race Through Space
Description:
Can you win the space race to the intergalactic space station? From fiery Mercury, beyond Pluto and into the depths of space, you and up to 5 friends must battle past asteroid storms and alien ships to reach the space station with life-saving supplies!
Contains board, 6 space shuttle markers, spinner and electronic dice.
A variant of snakes and ladders with the spinner directing whether you go up the board or down in certain spaces.
The dice is a small sphere you tap it then flashes-beeps over two seconds and shows you a random dice face on LEDs.

Name: Escape from Lovecrypt's Tomb?
Description: From the author, Escape from Lovecrypt's Tomb is a maze/treasure hunt game for one or two players. It requires a standard deck of cards (not provided), a couple of pieces to represent the player or players, and about 50 tokens (pennies, pente' stones, candy corn, petrified squirrel droppings, whatever...). The package contains rules and two variant game boards.

Name: Space Shuttle Adventure
Description:
Endorsed by the U.S. Space Academy:

Imagine the thrill of the countdown beginning - All systems are go.  The Lift-Off begins and you're in orbit.  - The adventure of going into space.  The thrill now comes alive with space shuttle adventure....A game endorsed by the U.S. Space Academy that is not only an adventure but a learning experience for young and old.

Discover the adventure, the obstacles the astronauts must overcome...from the challenge of pre-launch and the thrill of lift-off to the uncertainties of orbit and the celebration of re-entry.  You'll learn the terms and feel of the adventure as if you were a part of the great space program.

Name: UNO: Polly Pocket
Description:
The usual UNO rules - Players race to empty their hands and catch opposing players with cards left in theirs, which score points. In turns, players attempt to play a card by matching its color or number to the topmost card on the discard pile. If unable to play, players draw cards from the draw pile until they are able to place a card. Wild and special cards spice things up a bit. Additionally, when playing their penultimate card from their hand, players must shout 'UNO' or face a forfeit of drawing two further cards.

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: Rockin' Blockin' card - a special wild card that can be used in two different ways:

Rock the card:  Play this card and each of your opponents must draw one card from the draw pile.

Block their cards:  If the player before you plays a Wild Draw 4 card, you can instantly discard the Rockin' Blockin' card to  block their card.  If you do this, you don't have to draw four cards and you still get to take your turn.
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: No Limits
Description:
No Limits is a generic science fiction miniatures game system for use with miniatures from any 25mm to 30mm manufacturer.

The No Limits system uses an alternate unit activation turn sequence in which players take turns in moving and fighting with units until all units have been activated. It uses 10 sided dice for it's dice mechanics.

Also available in French!!!

Name: Chinese Jackstraws
Description: Two players race to build a tower using chopsticks.  Twelve  wooden cylinders (that the game calls "suey") start in a bowl build into the box insert.  Players race to pick up the cylinders with their chopsticks and stack them upon their own wooden base.

Name: Zombies!!! 7: Send in the Clowns
Description:
The circus is in town! This time though, the clowns aren’t funny… They’re hungry and they think you would make a good snack!

Zombies!!! 7: Send in the Clowns pits you against the traveling carnival of the damned. Visit the Big Top, and the Fortune Teller. Get lost in the Fun House. Enjoy some cotton candy. Actually, forget all that and get ready to run screaming from the growing mob of zombie clowns.

This expansion could be played stand-alone with shotgun guys (or other player markers) and tokens for bullets and hearts.

Part of the Zombies!!! series.

Name: Tellusspelet
Description:
You start at earth creation, and with help of a dice race towards the space age.

The game mechanism is simular to the game 'Snakes and Ladders'.

Name: Mr. Pokerface
Description:
Content:
45 cards, 2 dice

The funny-smart table tennis-card game
Whether you get a smash on you forehand or a topspin at your backhand, a proper "Mr. Pokerface knows an answer to the net balls and edge balls. That no one watches what good capacities are inside him he plays under cover sometimes, and no tremor in his face says if he speaks the truth.

Name: Fritze Flink
Description:
Content:
31 character cards: the x,y,z,q are out

The active player draws himself 10 cards for his hand.
Now he has 90 sec of time to build words with his characters. A word must have at least 3 characters. 
For a new second word he has to use the last character of his former word.
The not used characters of the first old word can be taken in the hand again.

When time is over, the active player gets as many points as characters are in his words.

Name: Gaga!
Description:
The game consists of three sets of twelve cards: 3 to 9 and some special cards. Each player receives one set of cards

Gaga is a card trick game. The players play their card simultaneously and blind. The highest card gets the trick; if there is a two-way tie, the remaining player gets the trick. If there is a three-way tie, the winner of the next trick gets this trick as well. The special cards have other ways to win (or loose) a trick.

When one of the players has run out of cards, each player counts his points. Some cards show chickens, and are worth points; others show animal droppings, and lower your point total.

The player who has gained the most points after three rounds wins the game.

Name: Piks!
Description:
Content: 37 cards in three colors with number 1-10,
10 is double, 4 watering cans

At the beginning each player gets a watering can for his hand.
8 cards are put face down in the middle of the table.
The rest of the cards are put face up and mixed up at the table. The players take turns in taking one open or one blind card, until all cards are dealt equally.
All players lay out a blind card. At the same time they are opened. Are there any with the same color?
If this happens, that player with the highest value of this color gets all cards.
After all cards are played each of the players count their 
cards. The winner has the fewest cards.

Name: Das Dornröschen-Spiel
Description:
Content:
1 board
40 fairytale cards
16 fairy cards (8 good fairy, 8 evil fairy)
1 bright magic wand for good fairies,
1 dark magic wand for evil fairies

Each player gets a series of fairytale cards with numbers 1-10, 2 good fairies, 2 evil fairies

The idea is: 
Each player shuffles his 14 cards and lays them as a hidden deck in front of him at the table.
At his turn the player draws an own card and tries to place it onto a field with the same number. 
If the opened card is an evil fairy he takes his dark magic wand and turns an discarded card face down. Here no card may be laid until a good fairy turns it back open again.

The player who can discard his hand first wins

Name: 3/4Takt
Description:
The game is packed in a can. 
Content:
57 stones in different colors,
9 cards with 4 rings at it

In the basic game with 2 players one gets 18 red, the other 18 green stones.
The cards have to be laid in a square.

Alternately each player sets a stone onto a ring of one of the square cards. The valuation starts after 3 stones:
One point for 4 stones on one card, or 4 stones in 4 rings side by side, a.s.o

When all stones are laid, the game is over.

There are also 4 cooperative versions.

Name: Planet der Wunder
Description:
Content:
board,
6 water drops,
1 bonus ring,
18 wonder-taler
1 special die
500 cards with 1000 questions

The players travel with their pawns around the planet in order to get to know the wonders of the nature.
Those who answer the question correctly, get ahead quicker, or slower.
Because the questions refer to unusual facts, 3 answers are already printed for your choice.

Winner is the player who has arrived "Start" first.

Name: Monopoly: My NBA
Description:
Choose 22 of 30 National Basketball Association Teams and place them on the game board where you want.  Then...buy, sell and trade your favorite teams in an effort to own and control the NBA, a basketball fan's fantasy.  The team labels are removable and reusable so, if you choose, you can play different a game each time.

It's as much fun to set up as it is to play!

Name: Luftikus
Description:
Each player gets 6 tiles in different colors.
6 tiles with a star are placed on the table in a circle.
The Luftikus, a single pawn, is placed on one of the tiles.

Assembly-Phase:
The players are taking turns in throwing the die and moving the Luftikus in the circle by the number of the die. The color where the Luftikus landed can be taken away out of his 6 tiles. If it reaches "green", the green tile of the active player is placed aside. Then the active player rolls the die again and hits "blue". His blue tile is set upon his green tile from the turn before to start a tower of tiles. He can play so long until a color is hit that is already in the tower. When all player have finished their turn, that player with the first finished tower gets the left over tiles of the other players as points.

Disassembly-Phase:
Then the tower is build down, accordingly to the first phase.

Name: 'Ohana Proa
Description:
Ohana Proa models a gift economy in the Polynesian islands.  It is a game of route building, deliveries and gift giving.  The challenge of the game is. How to get ahead when the primary method of gaining points is by improving other player's positions?

'Ohana Proa was developed publicly via a blog on BGDF.

				
				
					IntroductionThe societies of the South Pacific were characterized by gift economies in which wealth and status were defined by what was given to others rather than personal accumulation. In Ohana Proa players will compete for prestige via gift-giving and thus improving the other player's positions.

During the course of the game players will explore and claim routes among the islands. The number of routes a player may explore and claim each turn is limited by the number of explorers the player has (maximum 2).

Players will also join markets among the islands by moving them along 'claimed routes and in doing so attempt to gather them into groups. A group of three, four or five markets (player choice) is "satisfied" and is removed from the game. The number of routes that a player may move a market over during a delivery is limited by the player's proas (boats, maximum 7).

By delivering markets through islands where they have network presence players will receive fish or shells. Fish and shells may be used to gain an additional explorer, to acquire more proas or kahunas, to bid for turn order, to claim explored routes and to make and enhance kula items. Kula items are gifts that may be given to other players in order to gain prestige (but give the recipient points).

Fish rot quickly and are lost if not spent quickly enough. Shells rot more slowly and kula items decay. Kula items can be enhanced with fish or shells to increase their value when given.

The game ends when all of one colour of market has been delivered, a player reaches 33 prestige or the players reach deadlock. The player(s) with the lowest prestige score are eliminated from the game and do not score. The remaining players receive additional points for their prestige scores. The highest score wins.

Ohana Proa supports 3 through 5 players, is particularly recommended for 4 players and plays in around 150 minutes.

Name: Knabberbande
Description: A trick-taking little game with prickly kakties, carrots-greedy hare-robbers and silly hens!

Name: Jan van Haasteren's Verjaardagsspel
Description: This is a simple, family  roll-and-move game to be played on someone's birthday.  It is lavishly illustrated by the popular artist Jan van Haasteren.  The game is 63 spaces, with certain spaces allowing 'jump forwards' and other special events, and other spaces requiring the shouts of 'hip hip hooray' by the crowd.  This is a variant on the famous 'Ganzenbord', or Dutch Goose game.

Name: Monopoly: New York Mets
Description:
The MONOPOLY game joins Major League Baseball® to bring you the ultimate dream - owning the Mets greatest assets. The best of the Mets are up for grabs, and it’s every fan for him or herself!

Now fans can experience Mets excitement in and out of the ballpark in this New York Mets Collector’s Edition of the MONOPOLY game. Buy, sell and trade legendary stars Tom Seaver, Gil Hodges, Keith Hernandez and current stars Mike Piazza, Pedro Martinez and Carlos Beltran in a quest to own all the Mets greatest assets. Home to some of the most skillful players in Major League Baseball, the Mets continue to make for exciting play in this classic game of risk taking and deal making. Includes six collectible pewter tokens for the true baseball fan - Mets baseball cap, hotdog, batter, pitcher, ball in glove and catcher’s mask.

Name: Monopoly: New York Yankees
Description:
Play Ball! Licensed by Major League Baseball® we bring you the ultimate collector’s edition of the MONOPOLY game featuring the best of the New York Yankees.

Compete to own the greatest Yankees assets which include Yankees Hall of Fame™ players like Yogi Berra, all-time greats like Roger Maris and the 1926 World Series® championship and current stars like Alex Rodriguez, Jason Giambi and Jorge Posada.

Name: Tit Tat Toe: Marble Game
Description:
This is a vintage Parker Brothers table game that combines pinball or pachinko with Tic Tac Toe. Judging by the art deco/American "streamline" design, the best guess would be that it dates from the mid-1930s to early 1940s.

The playing field consists of a Tic Tac Toe grid with holes in each square surrounded with wooden pegs inserted at various points to serve as bumpers. Players alternate hitting a metal lever to launch marbles up a chute and onto the playing field in an attempt to get their marbles to settle into the squares. As with Tic Tac Toe, the winner is the first to get 3 marbles settled in a row.

Name: Safari Dice: Africa's Big Game
Description:
A simple dice game similar to Yahtzee. The player rolls five dice, which depict 5 different animals (giraffe, buffalo, rhino, lion and elephant) and a poacher. There is a scoresheet where you attempt to collect various sets (e.g. 3 giraffes, or 5 different animals), you get a varying number of points based on the difficulty of the set you are trying to collect. The poacher causes a player to lose 5 points for each poacher revealed. If you roll 5 poachers all your animals are dead and you are out of the game!

The game is complete after 15 turns. The player with the highest point tally wins.

Name: Gettu betur: spurningaspilið
Description:
An Icelandic trivia game based on one of Icelands' most popular tv shows, the Gettu Betur trivia show where students representing their secondary schools compete for the Golden Microphone.

There are 2200 questions (language dependent) in this version of the board game which is aimed at adults.

Name: Donkey Kong Country
Description:
Set up a cardboard backdrop and attempt to pitch POGs accurately behind walls and into holes in the correct order to win the game.

This game includes a complete set of 36 Donkey Kong Country milk caps exclusive to this game.

Name: Great War at Sea: Airships
Description:
For a brief period, Ferdinand Graf von Zeppelin's giant floating cylinders seemed poised to play a major role in naval warfare. But just as the technology matured, high-performance aircraft, a spectacular accident caught on film and the Great Depression combined to bring an end to military and most civilian use of the rigid airship.

Airships is a supplement for our Great War at Sea series of games, building on the popular Zeppelins to take a further look at lighter than air operations. There are ten scenarios, or separate game situations, based on missions that took place or could have taken place. All are by Ernie Wheeler and Doug McNair.

This module is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of our Zeppelins supplement and Jutland and Mediterranean games to play most of the scenarios, and our U.S. Navy Plan Gold game and Sea of Troubles and Dreadnoughts supplements to play all of them. Each scenario has its own card in a spiral-bound booklet.
Families: Series: Great War at Sea (Avalanche Press)

Name: I Spy Spooky Night
Description:
From the publisher: "Skeletons dance, pumpkins delight, play I Spy on a Spooky Night!
Matching and memory game. When all of the matches have been made, turn the cards face-up and find the pictures to solve the riddles.
Several ways to play for added fun!"

Name: I Spy "Word Scramble" Game
Description: From the publisher: "Do you spy a face? Green eyes? A grin? Slide the letters in place! SCRAMBLE! You win! I Spy Word Scramble has won many awards since its debut, including iParenting Media Award and Nick Jr. Best Toy Award."

Name: 24 Card Game
Description:
From the publisher:

"A terrorist has infiltrated the CTU - and it's up to you to save the day! As Agents, you have to uncover which player is the terrorist, using your keen powers of observation and the latest advances in technology. Meanwhile, the covert Terrorist will be trying to collect contraband tech to thwart detection by Jack and the CTU team.

The clock is ticking...can you identify the terrorist in time?"

The players are dealt eight cards. During this initial deal, one player is assigned the role of terrorist. There are twenty-four rounds of gameplay. Each round tells the players which suit must be played in order to win the trick. The Jack Bauer Card is wild and wins any trick. A player who wins a trick must either draw and keep two cards or draw and follow the instructions from the top card of the Action Deck.

The terrorist wins the game by not being eliminated and having the most points or by eliminating all the other players. Any other player can win by eliminating the terrorist or by having the most points.


        Note: This is essentially the same game as 24 Countdown Game, except that it uses a sleeved card for the timer, instead of a board.
    


  Buy Microbadge - 24 fan

 Buy Microbadge - Kiefer Sutherland is a character Jack Bauer plays when he's not saving the world.

Name: The Little Mermaid Happily Ever After Card Game
Description: A card game where you must help Ariel kiss her Prince before sunset so she can become human and live happily ever after.
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: The Little Mermaid

Name: Władcy Smoków
Description:
Simple bluffing game for youngsters. Every player has miniatures dragons and an identical set of order cards. The play consists of simultaneous secret assignment of orders to the dragons. The point is to outsmart your opponent and kill his dragon by wounding him 3 times.

'WÅ‚adcy Smoków'  (Dragon Lords) were included as a free gift in issue 46 and 47 of the Polish edition of 'Kaczor Donald' (Donald Duck) magazine published December 2007.

Name: 100 Keren
Description:
In this game that was released as a special game for the opening of the 100th Primafoon shop in the Netherlands, you have to try to make combinations.

In the middle of the board there is place for 25 caps. On your turn you have to try to make color and / or picture combos. The bigger the combo the higher the score. When you take a specific score (minimal a combo of 3) the caps of that combo are taken off of the board, for which there come new caps in place.

The game is played till all 100 caps are used and there are no combos possible on the board anymore. The winner is the person with the highest score.

Name: Scooby-Doo Gold Rush Game
Description:
Join Scooby-Doo and his friends on a clue seeking adventure! Spin the spinner and move your character along the path. If you land on the right space you get a clue token.....But, this special spinner has a monster at the other end and if it lands on a Gotcha! space—Look Out! One of the players is going to have to go for a ride. If it's you, you'll go spinning around, but you won't be able to collect clue tokens until your luck gets better and you get out! The first player to collect three tokens and get back to start wins!

Includes: Game board, deluxe plastic spinner, 5 movers, 5 mover stands, monster piece, clue tokens, snack tokens, game die, label sheet, and instructions.

From Pressman Games.

Name: Monopoly: The Here & Now New Zealand Edition
Description:
(from the box)

What would monopoly be like if it were invented today...?
New Zealand has changed over the last few decades. This special aniversary edition celebrates 21 years of NZ's favourite game with a modern day equivalent that was voted by New Zealanders.

Choose from a range of new tokens including a mobile phone,jandals, sheep or even a jar of vegemite!

Rents have skyrocketed all over the country and you can build property in places like the Waitomo Caves, Cathedral Square or next to the Ohakune Carrot.

Play to win New Zealand - in millions of dollars, not just hundreds!

Name: Potion-Making: University Course
Description:
Potion-Making: University Course, the first expansion for Potion-Making: Practice, provides an advanced program of magic and sorcery for students who already know how to mix simple elixirs and make magic powders, students who are not afraid of mysterious spells and creatures.

Potion-Making: University Course consists of a deck of 63 cards, with new ingredients, spells, creatures and recipes. This deck is not mixed with the deck of the base game, Potion-Making: Practice, but rather placed next to it. Each of your turns will now consist of three phases in which you can take cards from either deck and play them. For example, you can draw two cards and make a potion, or you can place a card on the table as an element and use this element for a new potion immediately. Thanks to the new rules, it's possible to make different sophisticated combinations.

Four "Lesser Talismans" give players certain bonuses; for example, the Lesser Talisman of Usefulness gives you 1 point for any card you play as an element, even if the desk already holds that element. The special artifact "Scruple of Conscience" can be passed to any player who has more points than you; he must add the card to his hand and lose 5 points – but be careful as this card can boomerang back to you. The new "Haste" spell let you play two cards in a row, while "Magic Vortex" places all ingredient cards of all completed formulas on the desk of elements. Now you'll have a huge choice of elements!

The expansion Potion-Making: Guild of Alchemists can also be combined with University Course, which means three separate decks would be in play.

Name: Potion-Making: Guild Of Alchemists
Description:
Potion-Making: Guild Of Alchemists, the second expansion for Potion-Making: Practice, adds another deck of cards to the game. With this expansion, the players can now attempt to create the Philosopher's Stone. How? At the start of the game, each player receives a Magnum Opus card that shows a succession of formulas. If you manage to fulfill the list you've been given, you create a Philosopher's Stone, the game ends, and you earn additional points.

Potion-Making: Guild Of Alchemists also includes new formulas, spells and rules, and while you need the base game in order to play, the Practice and Guild Of Alchemists remain separate. Each turn now consists of three phases in which you can draw cards from either deck and play them as elements or formulas, therefore giving you new opportunities to carry out your strategy and invent ingenious combinations.

"Elementary granum", a new element in the expansion, can be used as any element when creating a formula, then can replace any other element. The expansion also includes "Elixir of Omnitude", which can replace any simple (two-component) elixir – but if someone takes your completed formula made with this Elixir or with Elementary granum, you won't score half the points in compensation. Yes, there are benefits for paying for everything.

The expansion Potion-Making: University Course can also be "combined" with Guild Of Alchemists, which means three separate decks would be in play.

Name: Democratic: El Juego de la Democracia
Description: A political game where each participant is at the forefront of a political party and should undertake an election campaign, travel across the country, participate in elections, investing in advertising, and if necessary, go to the courts in defense of allegations received. All of this ends in the general election and the votes tell who will be the president.

Name: Ambassadeur: Een reis om de wereld in 80 rechten
Description:
This game with a special formed board is released in the Netherlands as a promotion of the Stichting Kinderpostzegels.

Every players starts in a capital city of a country and the first  person who reaches his orher capital city again (by going around the board once) wins the game. Winning is just a matter of luck in this game.

Components: gameboard, 50 law cards, 30 challenge cards, 6 pawns, 2 dice, 6 "unlucky" containers and the rules.

Name: V Invasión Extraterrestre
Description:
Galaxy battle game, with a version based on the TV Series "V".

Board with 77 squares with different numbers written. The game brings 10 yellow cards and 10 green (each color represents one side). In the center of the board have 2 areas of "Red Dust" covering 6 squares each. In 2 of the 4 ends of the board have squares representing 4 cities or countries. Each placer must distribute each counter in the board, both sides are Visitor (no one represent the Resistance), and each card represents a weapon or vehicle with different powers.

The game is a mix of chess and chequers since the counters can be moved in a certain way. To destroy a counter, this has to be less than or equal power of the attacker. The game ends when one can infiltrate any of its ships within the area of cities or countries that it is protecting his opponent.

Name: Arabian Nights Flying Carpet Game
Description: A vintage game in which you have to rotate a clock to know where to go on a board, which looks like a snakes and ladders board. Actions that have to be taken, are related to the stories of 1001 Nights.

Name: Postal Delivery Boys
Description: A game in the style of The Game of District Messenger Boy. Players start off as postal delivery boys and race to be the first player to reach the center square and become president of the company. Spin and move - but try to avoid the penalty squares which will slow your progress.
